definitions.definition: Pertaining to persons ( human beings as opposed to things or animals).
Of or pertaining to a particular person; relating to, or affecting, an individual , or each of many individuals
examples: Her song was her personal look at the values of friendship.

definitions.definition: Dealing with subjects about which one wishes (or people usually wish) to maintain privacy or discretion ; not for public view; sensitive , intimate .
examples: You can't read my diary—it is personal .
I can't believe you went through my drawers and looked at all my personal things!

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the external or bodily appearance; corporeal; bodily .
Done in person; without an intermediary .
Relating to an individual, their character, conduct, motives, or private affairs, in an invidious and offensive manner
examples: Only factual argumentation, no need to get personal .

definitions.definition: Of a noun or pronoun, having reference particular to humans and other entities having personality such as a named animal, a deity, a personification, etc.
Related to grammatical first , second , etc. persons.

examples: one's personal vehicle, as opposed to a company vehicle
